paragraphs.body: Please, allow me to try putting things in perspective. First of all, in this wiki, we admins have had a number of issues with vandalism, that has made us somewhat overly cautions about things. Second, you spoke with Zero, who is one of our most zealous admins. Third, you only think "barely 800" articles is little cause you weren't here May last year, when our article count was somewhere in the 200s, I don't know how things are in other Nick show wikis, and to be honest, I have little interest in knowing, I came to this wiki cause it's one that I felt like I could do something good for it, and I was right, cause in less than a year, I went from new member to Bureaucrat. I've had bad experiences here too, so don't let one bad experience screw things up. The Avatar fandom is known for being somewhat crazy and fierce when it comes to the show, and that extends to us, both in good and bad ways. Omnibender - Talk - Contributions 18:17, 25 January 2009 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: Please, allow me to try putting things in perspective. First of all, in this wiki, we admins have had a number of issues with vandalism, that has made us somewhat overly cautions about things. Second, you spoke with Zero, who is one of our most zealous admins. Third, you only think "barely 800" articles is little cause you weren't here May last year, when our article count was somewhere in the 200s, I don't know how things are in other Nick show wikis, and to be honest, I have little interest in knowing, I came to this wiki cause it's one that I felt like I could do something good for it, and I was right, cause in less than a year, I went from new member to Bureaucrat. I've had bad experiences here too, so don't let one bad experience screw things up. The Avatar fandom is known for being somewhat crazy and fierce when it comes to the show, and that extends to us, both in good and bad ways. Omnibender - Talk - Contributions 18:17, 25 January 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Whoa whoa. I'm afraid I made a mistake when I said "sysops". Recap: When Thailog gave that advice about "member" I told him that we would think about it. A Perfectly neutral answer. Then he asked who "we" were I answered "sysops" (My mistake, I should have said Sysops and Regulars). And then he voiced his realization that we were "one of those wikis". Assuming that he was talking about wikis who believe in total domination I assured him that we were not and said we were in the middle of the two extremes where one is Total Domination and the other is Total Surrender of All Control. I believe such a moderate policy is what we do. Anyway I meant no offense. Evaluation: Upon close examination the only thing I can think of doing wrong is saying "Sysops" instead of "Sysops and Regular Users". I missed the last part by mistake. Sorry about that. I was not explanatory enough. I will try not to make such a mistake again. I appologise for my mistakes.  - Zero - Talk 19:34, 25 January 2009 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: Whoa whoa. I'm afraid I made a mistake when I said "sysops". Recap: When Thailog gave that advice about "member" I told him that we would think about it. A Perfectly neutral answer. Then he asked who "we" were I answered "sysops" (My mistake, I should have said Sysops and Regulars). And then he voiced his realization that we were "one of those wikis". Assuming that he was talking about wikis who believe in total domination I assured him that we were not and said we were in the middle of the two extremes where one is Total Domination and the other is Total Surrender of All Control. I believe such a moderate policy is what we do. Anyway I meant no offense. Evaluation: Upon close examination the only thing I can think of doing wrong is saying "Sysops" instead of "Sysops and Regular Users". I missed the last part by mistake. Sorry about that. I was not explanatory enough. I will try not to make such a mistake again. I appologise for my mistakes.  - Zero - Talk 19:34, 25 January 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: How about icons for benders? To me it makes more sense to distinguish people by bendering arts than Nations. The color of the character infobox pretty much states what nation each character is from, but not every character from a nation is a bender. ― Thailog 13:43, 15 February 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: No there is no need for that. The Nation Emblems will do for the Benders as well. Besides, the world is divided into four but guided by one, remember?  - Zero - Talk 13:50, 15 February 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Hey. I do not like beating about the bush. What you call blunt is me being concise. Anyways, to put it simply, have you seen these bending icons you are talking about? They look more like a kid's scibbles than emblems. That is the reason why we do this. Now leave it be. And the statement of "the world is divided into four but guided by one" is a quote from the Maps of the Avatar World. It means that the world is divided into four peoples and guided by one Avatar. And before you say anything, neutral is needed because there are those who's allegiances are uncertain at best and unknown or completely seperate at worst. So, 888 is right. We do not need the bending icons. Thanks anyways.  - Zero - Talk 10:14, 16 February 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Actually on two pages, since both Aang and the Lion Turtle can use it. But you're missing the point. We cannot roll this out if it is incomplete. If we are going to place bending icons then we should have one for energybending as well. If we don't theyn it's far better off that we let go of the bending icons idea altogether and just rely on the Nation emblems. Besides, I really see no point in this whole bending icon thing when we have the nation icons to represent the allegiance. This template was supposed to indicate base allegiance to bending type, not bending itself.  - Zero - Talk 10:02, 18 February 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Sub-bendings and other fighting styles cannot compare with the Original Bending Art of the Avatar World. Thus if there are going to be bending icons for the four elements then there should be one for the original bending. Instead of making long speeches, try finding a suitable icon. After all, The Neutral Icon is not used in the Avatar World. Find one that can be associated with energybending. Just make sure it is purple. BTW I only see one in agreement, one in disagreement and two in thought.  - Zero - Talk 14:20, 19 February 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: BTW, you may want to tone it down when using the imperative form. You give off the impression you are issuing commands. You’ll find that a more polite phrasing (please, could you, can you) is much more productive, and it won't let you come off as bossy.
